ax-config.html.title: Global Configuration
ax-config.html.contents: $custom (Map) scss $custom: () !default; Configuration to be injected by consumers. Used By $merged $default (Map) scss $default: ( layout: ( length: ( min: 2, max: 12, line: 4, ), container: ( mapped: ( domain: $sizes, function: meta.get-function("container"), ), literal: (), logical: ( page: "xl", ), ), spacing: ( literal: ( block: "var(--length-l1)", heading: "var(--length-l1)", sectioning: "clamp(var(--length-l1), (100vi - var(--container-sm)) / 4, var(--length-l2))", inline: 4ch, inline-small: 0.5ch, ), logical: (), ), ), typography: ( font-family: ( literal: ( sans: ( "Source Sans Pro", sans-serif, ), serif: ( "Source Serif Pro", serif, ), mono: ( "Source Code Pro", monospace, ), ), logical: ( body: "serif", heading: "sans", display: "body", ), ), font-weight: ( literal: ( regular: 400, bold: 700, ), logical: ( body: "regular", emphasis: "bold", heading: "bold", ), ), line: ( min: 1.1, root: 1.5, sub: 1, ), measure: ( mapped: ( domain: $sizes, function: meta.get-function("measure"), ), literal: ( full: 100%, inf: unset, ), logical: ( default: md, ), ), scale: ( min: -2, max: 9, base: 1em, // Major third, equal-tempered: 2  1.26 // https://www.modularscale.com/?1&em&2@3 factor: math.pow(2, math.div(1, 3)), literal: (), logical: (), ), ), ui: ( radius: ( mapped: ( domain: $sizes, function: meta.get-function("radius"), ), literal: ( 100: 100%, full: 999rem, ), ), shadow: ( mapped: ( domain: $sizes, function: meta.get-function("shadow"), ), ), stroke: ( width: ( min: 1, max: 8, line: 24, literal: (), logical: ( default: 2, ), ), style: ( literal: ( default: "solid", ), logical: (), ), color: ( literal: ( default: "var(--color-tertiary-700)", ), logical: (), ), ), ), color: ( palettes: (), literal: (), logical: (), ), ); Default configuration. Used By $merged $merged (Map) scss $merged: map.deep-merge($default, $custom); Map of all configuration values merged together. Requires $default (Map) $custom (Map) Used By Container Size Scale Length Scale Spacing Values Font Weights Line Heights Measure Scale Modular Font Size Scale Stroke Colors Stroke Styles Stroke Width Scale $palettes@brand scss $palettes: ( "grey": ( hue: $prim, sl-curve: .1 .9 .2 .9 .2 .1 .1 .1, range: ( step: 0.1, start: 0, end: 1, ), ), "primary": ( hue: $prim, sl-curve: $sl-curve, ), "secondary": ( hue: $prim + $dist, sl-curve: $sl-curve, ), "tertiary": ( hue: $prim - $dist, sl-curve: $sl-curve, ), ); Colors. $mapping@logical scss $mapping: ( body: "black", body-contra: "white", neutral: "grey", alternate: "grey-700", alternate-contra: "grey-100", mark: "grey-900", mark-contra: "grey-200", heading: "primary-700", heading-contra: "primary-300", heading-alternate: "tertiary-700", heading-alternate-contra: "tertiary-300", links: "secondary-700", links-contra: "secondary-300", links-alternate: "secondary-500", links-alternate-contra: "secondary-300", nav: "heading", nav-contra: "heading-contra", hr: "primary", ); Colors. $palettes@seed scss $palettes: ( "grey": ( hue: 215, s-curve: ( 0.2104, -0.6858, 0.8695, ), l-curve: ( 0.987, 0.1053, -2.9242, 1.8939, ), range: ( step: 0.1, start: 0, end: 1, ), ), "red": ( hue: 0, s-curve: ( 1.31, -1.35, 0.5, ), l-curve: ( 1, -0.2151, -3.2645, 3.5435, 2.6872, -3.7511, ), ), "green": ( hue: 145, s-curve: ( 1.11, -2.3, 2, ), l-curve: ( 1.0027, -0.8562, -0.1438, ), ), "blue": ( hue: 207, s-curve: ( 0.7863, 0.2, -0.625, ), l-curve: ( 1.0014, -2.0957, 3.9528, -2.8571, ), ), "pink": ( hue: 332, s-curve: ( 0.99, -0.15, -0.5, ), l-curve: ( 1.004, -0.7445, 0.8159, -1.0714, ), ), "purple": ( hue: 259, s-curve: ( 1.3838, -2.4, 1.625, ), l-curve: ( 1.0046, -1.3597, 2.1454, -1.7857, ), ), "teal": ( hue: 176, s-curve: ( 1.0825, -1.75, 1.25, ), l-curve: ( 1.0032, -1.2173, 0.5745, -0.3571, ), ), "yellow": ( hue: 46, s-curve: ( 1.0288, -0.25, -0.375, ), l-curve: ( 1.0028, -1.3466, 2.1323, -1.7857, ), ), "orange": ( hue: 28, s-curve: ( 1.065, -0.45, ), l-curve: ( 1.005, -1.3037, 1.8513, -1.5476, ), ), "brown": ( hue: 15, s-curve: ( -0.1688, 1.4, -1.125, ), l-curve: ( 1.0017, -2.1894, 2.7371, -1.5476, ), ), ); Colors derived from Pollens color palette.

ax-generic.html.title: Generic Rules
ax-generic.html.contents: normalize.css Stylament uses normalize.css for normalizing browser styling. nize.css Stylament uses nize.css to extend basic styling with slots for CSS custom properties. Target Scroll Spacing scss :target { // Give URL fragment target enough air. scroll-margin-block-start: var(--length-l3); } The current target element. General Measure scss :where(h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, h6, p, address, summary, figcaption, caption) { max-inline-size: var(--measure); } Establish a generic measure. * scss * { ---clr-fg: var(---clr-pos); ---clr-bg: var(---clr-neg); } Set abstract colors.

ax-properties.html.title: Custom Properties
ax-properties.html.contents: Basic Custom Properties This is a set of global custom CSS properties constituting the DNA of the design system. It was originally inspired by the well thought-through taxonomy of Pollen. Color Color Palettes scss :root { $conf: map.get(cfg.$merged, color); $prefix: "color"; @each $name, $pal in map.get($conf, palettes) { @include color.palette( $name, map.get($pal, hue), map.get($pal, s-curve), map.get($pal, l-curve), map.get($pal, sl-curve), map.get($pal, range), $prefix ); } @include prop-map.configured-properties($conf, $prefix); } Layout $sizes (Map) scss $sizes: (); Container sizes. Defined in Container Size Scale. Related Why SASS variables? [external] Container Size Scale scss :root { $conf: map.get(cfg.$merged, layout, container); $sizes: map2.map-config($conf) !global; @include prop-map.configured-properties($conf, "container"); } Defines $sizes. Related Pollen inheritance [external] Requires $merged (Map) Length Scale scss :root { $min: map.get(cfg.$merged, layout, length, min); $max: map.get(cfg.$merged, layout, length, max); $line: map.get(cfg.$merged, layout, length, line); @include scale.length($min, $max, line.$rlh, $line); } Requires $merged (Map) $rlh (Number<rem>) Spacing Values scss :root { @include prop-map.configured-properties(map.get(cfg.$merged, layout, spacing), "spacing"); } Requires $merged (Map) Typography Font Families scss :root { @include prop-map.configured-properties( map.get(cfg.$merged, typography, font-family), "font" ); } Related Pollen inheritance [external] Font Weights scss :root { @include prop-map.configured-properties( map.get(cfg.$merged, typography, font-weight), "weight" ); } Related Pollen inheritance [external] Requires $merged (Map) Letter Spacing scss :root { --letter-xs: -0.05em; --letter-sm: -0.025em; --letter-none: 0em; --letter-lg: 0.025em; --letter-xl: 0.05em; } Related Pollen inheritance [external] To-do List Configure and calculate this. $rlh (Number<rem>) scss $rlh: null; Root line height. Defined in Line Heights. Related rlh: experimental CSS unit. [external] Line Heights Used By Length Scale Stroke Width Scale @function grid-line() Line Heights scss :root { $scale-base: map.get(cfg.$merged, typography, scale, base); $scale-factor: map.get(cfg.$merged, typography, scale, factor); $scale-min: map.get(cfg.$merged, typography, scale, min); $scale-max: map.get(cfg.$merged, typography, scale, max); $line-min: map.get(cfg.$merged, typography, line, min); $line-root: map.get(cfg.$merged, typography, line, root); $line-sub: map.get(cfg.$merged, typography, line, sub); $base-unit: math.unit($scale-base); $scale-base-rem: if( $base-unit == "em", $scale-base * math.div(1rem, 1em), if($base-unit == "%", $scale-base * math.div(1rem, 100%), $scale-base) ); $rlh: $line-root * $scale-base-rem !global; --line-root: #{$line-root}; --line-root-abs: #{$rlh}; @for $i from $scale-min through $scale-max { $font-size: scale.modular($scale-base, $scale-factor, $i); --line-#{$i}: #{rhythm.grid-line($font-size, $rlh, $line-min, $line-sub)}; } } Line heights supporting the vertical rhythm at every step of the scale. Defines $rlh. Related Pollen inheritance [external] Vertical rhythm calculation tool [external] Requires $merged (Map) Measure Scale scss :root { @include prop-map.configured-properties(map.get(cfg.$merged, typography, measure), "measure"); --measure: var(--measure-default); } Related Pollen inheritance [external] Wikipedia [external] Web Typography [external] Requires $merged (Map) Modular Font Size Scale scss :root { $conf: map.get(cfg.$merged, typography, scale); $base: map.get($conf, base); $factor: map.get($conf, factor); $min: map.get($conf, min); $max: map.get($conf, max); $prefix: "scale"; --#{$prefix}-factor: #{$factor}; @for $i from $min through $max { --#{$prefix}-#{$i}: #{scale.modular($base, $factor, $i)}; } --#{$prefix}-smaller: #{math.div(100%, $factor)}; --#{$prefix}-larger: #{100% * $factor}; @include prop-map.configured-properties($conf, $prefix); } Related Pollen inheritance [external] Requires $merged (Map) UI Easing Curves Easing functions [introduced by Robert Penner][penner] and approximated as cubic Bzier curves [by Matthew Lein][ceaser]. [penner]: http://robertpenner.com/easing/ [ceaser]: https://matthewlein.com/tools/ceaser scss :root { --ease-in-quad: cubic-bezier(0.55, 0.085, 0.68, 0.53); --ease-in-cubic: cubic-bezier(0.55, 0.055, 0.675, 0.19); --ease-in-quart: cubic-bezier(0.895, 0.03, 0.685, 0.22); --ease-in-quint: cubic-bezier(0.755, 0.05, 0.855, 0.06); --ease-in-sine: cubic-bezier(0.47, 0, 0.745, 0.715); --ease-in-expo: cubic-bezier(0.95, 0.05, 0.795, 0.035); --ease-in-circ: cubic-bezier(0.6, 0.04, 0.98, 0.335); --ease-in-back: cubic-bezier(0.6, -0.28, 0.735, 0.045); --ease-out-quad: cubic-bezier(0.25, 0.46, 0.45, 0.94); --ease-out-cubic: cubic-bezier(0.215, 0.61, 0.355, 1); --ease-out-quart: cubic-bezier(0.165, 0.84, 0.44, 1); --ease-out-quint: cubic-bezier(0.23, 1, 0.32, 1); --ease-out-sine: cubic-bezier(0.39, 0.575, 0.565, 1); --ease-out-expo: cubic-bezier(0.19, 1, 0.22, 1); --ease-out-circ: cubic-bezier(0.075, 0.82, 0.165, 1); --ease-out-back: cubic-bezier(0.175, 0.885, 0.32, 1.275); --ease-in-out-quad: cubic-bezier(0.455, 0.03, 0.515, 0.955); --ease-in-out-cubic: cubic-bezier(0.645, 0.045, 0.355, 1); --ease-in-out-quart: cubic-bezier(0.77, 0, 0.175, 1); --ease-in-out-quint: cubic-bezier(0.86, 0, 0.07, 1); --ease-in-out-sine: cubic-bezier(0.445, 0.05, 0.55, 0.95); --ease-in-out-expo: cubic-bezier(1, 0, 0, 1); --ease-in-out-circ: cubic-bezier(0.785, 0.135, 0.15, 0.86); --ease-in-out-back: cubic-bezier(0.68, -0.55, 0.265, 1.55); --ease-default: ease-in-out; } Curves for transition easing. Radius Scale scss :root { @include prop-map.configured-properties( map.get(cfg.$merged, ui, radius), "radius" ); } Related Pollen inheritance [external] Shadow Scale scss :root { @include prop-map.configured-properties( map.get(cfg.$merged, ui, shadow), "shadow" ); } Box shadows for creating realistic elevation in 3d space. Related Pollen inheritance [external] Stroke Colors scss :root { @include prop-map.configured-properties( map.get(cfg.$merged, ui, stroke, color), "stroke-color" ); } Stroke Colors. Requires $merged (Map) Stroke Styles scss :root { @include prop-map.configured-properties( map.get(cfg.$merged, ui, stroke, style), "stroke-style" ); } Stroke Styles. Requires $merged (Map) Stroke Width Scale scss :root { $conf: map.get(cfg.$merged, ui, stroke, width); $min: map.get($conf, min); $max: map.get($conf, max); $line: map.get($conf, line); $prefix: "stroke-width"; @for $i from $min through $max { --#{$prefix}-#{$i}: #{line.$rlh * math.div($i, $line)}; } @include prop-map.configured-properties($conf, $prefix); } A scale of stroke widths with $line units per root line. Requires $merged (Map) $rlh (Number<rem>)

ax-tools.html.title: Preprocessing Tools
ax-tools.html.contents: @function polynomial() Polynomial function. Parameters & Return $x: (Number) The argument to the function. $coefficients: (List) The coefficients of the polynomial. @return (Number) The function value at $x. Used By @mixin palette() @function cubic-bezier() Cubic Bzier function, 1-dimensional. Parameters & Return $t: (Number) The argument to the function. $p0: (Number) First control point, P0. $p1: (Number) Second control point, P1. $p2: (Number) Third control point, P2. $p3: (Number) Fourth control point, P3. @return (Number) The function value at $t. Used By @function cubic-bezier-2d() @function cubic-bezier-2d() Cubic Bzier function, 2-dimensional. Parameters & Return $t: (Number) The argument to the function. $x0: (Number) Abscissa of first control point, P0. $y0: (Number) Ordinate of first control point, P0. $x1: (Number) Abscissa of second control point, P1. $y1: (Number) Ordinate of second control point, P1. $x2: (Number) Abscissa of third control point, P2. $y2: (Number) Ordinate of third control point, P2. $x3: (Number) Abscissa of fourth control point, P3. $y3: (Number) Ordinate of fourth control point, P3. @return (Number) The function value at $t. Requires @function cubic-bezier() Used By @function cubic-bezier-dia() @mixin palette() @function cubic-bezier-dia() Cubic Bzier function spanning the diagonal of the unit square. The first and fourth control points are fixed to (0, 0) and (1, 1), respectively. Parameters & Return $t: (Number) The argument to the function. $x1: (Number) Abscissa of second control point, P1. $y1: (Number) Ordinate of second control point, P1. $x2: (Number) Abscissa of third control point, P2. $y2: (Number) Ordinate of third control point, P2. @return (Number) The function value at $t. Requires @function cubic-bezier-2d() @function map-aliases() Translate a map of aliases to values from a dictionary. Each alias is asigned the value of the aliased dictionary key. Parameters & Return $aliases: (Map) Map of aliases. $dict: (Map) Dictionary to look up values. @return (Map) Map with aliases pointing to looked up values. Used By @function map-config() @function map-function() Translate a map of domain arguments to their values of a given function. Parameters & Return $domain: (Map) The domain on which to apply the function. $func: (Function) Function to apply. @return (Map) Map with domain symbols pointing to their function values. Used By @function map-config() @function map-config() Translate a property configuration to a set of properties. Parameters & Return $conf: (Map) Configuration map for this set of properties. @return (Map) A set of mapped, literal, and logical properties. Requires @function map-function() @function map-aliases() @function grid-line() Base-line grid compatible line height at a given font size. Parameters & Return $em: (Number<rem|em|%>) Font size to fit. $rlh: (Number<rem>) Root line height. $min: (Number) Minimum line height ratio. $sub: (Number) The number of line sub-divisions the grid allows. @return (Number<rem|unitless>) The minimum line height that fits the font size. For rem-based font sizes this is also in rem, otherwise a unit-less number. Requires $rlh (Number<rem>) @function modular() Modular scale at a given level. Parameters & Return $base: (Number<rem>) Base font size of the scale. $factor: (Number) Factor between adjacent steps of the modular scale. $level: (Number) Level on the scale. @return (Number<rem>) Font size at the given scale level. @mixin palette() Generate a color palette for a given hue. Parameters & Output $name: (String) The color name. $hue: (Number) The color hue (of HSL). $s-curve: (List) The polynomial coefficients defining the curve described by cartesian coordinates of palette step and saturation (of HSL). $l-curve: (List) The polynomial coefficients defining the curve described by cartesian coordinates of palette step and lightness (of HSL). $sl-curve: (List) The control points defining a cubic Bzier in a cartesian coordinate system of saturation and lightness (of HSL). If this is definded the other two curves are ignored. $range: (Map) Start, end, and step-size of the palette. $prefix: (String) Property name prefix. {CSS output} (code block) A list of --<prefix>-* custom properties containing the color values of the palette: --<prefix>-red-100: hsl(0deg, 100%, 95%); --<prefix>-red-300: hsl(0deg, 95%, 75%); --<prefix>-red-500: hsl(0deg, 76%, 57%); --<prefix>-red-700: hsl(0deg, 61%, 48%); --<prefix>-red-900: hsl(0deg, 50%, 29%); --<prefix>-red: var(--<prefix>-red-500); Requires @function cubic-bezier-2d() @function polynomial() @mixin literal-properties() List CSS custom properties. Parameters & Output $properties: (Map) Map of properties with simple literal values. $prefix: (String) Property name prefix. {CSS output} (code block) A list of --<prefix>-* custom properties with their respective values. Used By @mixin configured-properties() @mixin mapped-properties() Map CSS custom properties via a given function. Parameters & Output $domain: (Map) Map of inouts to the mapping function. $prefix: (String) Property name prefix. $func: (Function) Mapping function. {CSS output} (code block) A list of --<prefix>-* custom properties with their respective calculated values. Used By @mixin configured-properties() @mixin logical-properties() Map logical to basic CSS custom properties. Parameters & Output $properties: (Map) Map of logical properties. $prefix: (String) Property name prefix. {CSS output} (code block) A list of --<prefix>-* custom properties referring to others. Used By @mixin configured-properties() @mixin configured-properties() Generate all configured CSS custom properties. Parameters & Output $conf: (Map) Configuration map for this set of properties. $prefix: (String) Property name prefix. {CSS output} (code block) A list of mapped, literal, and logical --<prefix>-* custom properties. Requires @mixin mapped-properties() @mixin literal-properties() @mixin logical-properties() @mixin length() Numeric Length Scale This generates a scale of --length-<i> properties. The <i> indicates the number of sub-units the length is made up of. Logical Length Scale Additionally, there are aliases refer to use the main: --length-l<j>: exactly j lines --length-l<j>aug: a bit more than j lines --length-l<j>to<j+1>: right between j and j+1 lines --length-l<j+1>dim: a bit less than j+1 lines Parameters & Output $start: Start of the scale. $end: End of the scale. $basis: Scale basis (unit), e. g. the root line height. $sub: Sub-division of the scale basis, i. e. how many sub-units per main unit. {CSS output} (code block) A list of --length-* custom properties: /*  */ --length-4: 1.5rem; --length-l1: 1.5rem; --length-5: 1.875rem; --length-l1aug: 1.875rem; --length-6: 2.25rem; --length-l1to2: 2.25rem; --length-7: 2.625rem; --length-l2dim: 2.625rem; --length-8: 3rem; --length-l2: 3rem; /*  */

el-document.html.title: General Document Structure
el-document.html.contents: General Document Structure The following rules target elements that are (or should be) unique to each document. In some cases compound selectors are required in order to only select the specific element. Nevertheless, we can address them without any added class specificity. html scss html { font-size: var(--scale-root, 100%); } Document root. Also selectable as :root (which has a higher specificity). Related Spec [external] MDN [external] body scss body { @include coloring.set-colors("body"); @include coloring.use-colors; } Content root. Related Spec [external] MDN [external] main scss main { padding-block: var(--spacing-sectioning); } The documents main content. There can be only one (visible). Related Spec [external] MDN [external] $body-or-wrapper scss $body-or-wrapper: ":where(body, body > div:only-child)"; The body or an inevitable wrapper div. #{$body-or-wrapper} > :is(header, footer) scss #{$body-or-wrapper} > :is(header, footer) { padding-block: var(--spacing-sectioning); } The documents main header and footer. (There could be more than one of each. But that would not make much sense.) #{$body-or-wrapper} scss #{$body-or-wrapper} { min-block-size: 100vh; > footer { position: sticky; inset-block-start: 100vh; } } Apply clever sticky footer technique.

el-edits.html.title: Edits
el-edits.html.contents: Edits The ins and del elements represent edits to the document. Related Spec [external] MDN [external] del scss del { background: var(--color-red-300); } Deletion. ins scss ins { background: var(--color-green-300); } Insertion.

el-embedding.html.title: Embedding
el-embedding.html.contents: Embedding Embedding Containers No default styles needed. embed {} iframe {} object {} portal {} Related Spec [external] MDN [external] Multimedia Content No default styles needed. picture {} source {} img {} video {} audio {} track {} map {} area {} Related Spec (images) [external] Spec (embedded content) [external] Spec (media) [external] Spec (image maps) [external] MDN [external] Embedded Fragments of Other Markup Languages No default styles needed. svg {} math {} Related Spec [external] MDN [external]

el-forms.html.title: Form-associated Content
el-forms.html.contents: Form-associated Content These are elements which can be used together to create forms which the user can fill out and submit to the web site or application. Related Spec [external] MDN [external] General form scss form { } The form itself. button scss button { } Button. Submitting the form and other actionns. Labeling & Grouping label scss label { } Label. fieldset scss fieldset { } Fieldset. legend scss legend { } Legend. Inputs input scss input { } Input. textarea scss textarea { } Textarea. select scss select { } Select. Value Lists datalist scss datalist { } Datalist. option scss option { } Option. optgroup scss optgroup { } Optgroup. Outputs meter scss meter { } Meter. output scss output { } Output. progress scss progress { } Progress.

el-grouping.html.title: Grouping Content
el-grouping.html.contents: Block-level Text Content Definition list Self-contained figure Generic block div { /* Dont style the generic block! */ } List Paragraph Preformatted text Extended quotation Thematic break

el-interactive.html.title: Interactive Elements
el-interactive.html.contents: Interactive Elements These elements help to create interactive user interface objects. Related Spec [external] MDN [external] details scss details { } Details. The details element represents a disclosure widget from which the user can obtain additional information or controls. summary scss summary { } Summary. The summary element represents a summary, caption, or legend for the rest of the contents of the summary elements parent details element, if any. dialog scss dialog { } Dialog. The dialog element represents a part of an application that a user interacts with to perform a task, for example a dialog box, inspector, or window.

el-scripting.html.title: Scripting
el-scripting.html.contents: Scripting Scripts allow authors to add interactivity to their documents. Elements dedicated to scripting normally do not require styling. script {} noscript {} canvas {} Related Spec [external] MDN [external]

el-sectioning.html.title: Sectioning
el-sectioning.html.contents: Sectioning Heading Content General heading styles scss h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, h6 { @include coloring.set-colors("heading"); color: var(---clr-fg); } Level-specific heading styles scss h#{$level} { @include coloring.set-colors("heading-#{$level}", "heading"); } New (2022) hgroup semantics scss hgroup { p { font-family: var(--font-heading); font-weight: var(--weight-heading); color: var(---clr-fg); } h1 ~ p { font-size: var(--scale-2); line-height: var(--line-2); } h2 ~ p { font-size: var(--scale-1); line-height: var(--line-1); } } Sectioning Scope Specific Elements Sections

el-tables.html.title: Tabular Content
el-tables.html.contents: Tabular Content The elements here are used to create and handle tabular data (data with more than one dimension). Related Spec [external] MDN [external] table scss table { --border-width: var(--table-border-width, 0rem); border-collapse: collapse; padding: 0; border-spacing: 0; margin-block: calc(-0.5 * var(--border-width)); } The table itself. caption scss caption { margin-inline: auto; } Table caption. thead scss thead { } Table header. tbody scss tbody { } Table body. tfoot scss tfoot { } Table footer. tr scss tr { } Table row. td, th scss td, th { border: var(--border-width) var(--table-border-color) var(--table-border-style); padding: calc(0.5 * (var(--line-root-abs) - var(--border-width))); } Table cells.

el-text.html.title: Text-level Semantics
el-text.html.contents: Inline Text Semantics Altered Baseline Citation Inline Code Data Directionality Emphasis Enhanced Semantics Generic range span { /* Dont style the generic range! */ } Input/Output Line Breaks Inline Quotation Ruby Terminology

index.html.title: Stylament Documentation
index.html.contents: Stylament A fundament for your document styling. This is gonna be solid. And flexible. At the same time.  Awesome! What?  Spoiler : Yes, this is yet another HTML & CSS framework. Stylament is a framework or a blueprint for building well-structured and prettily-styled web pages. Why? After decades of using HTML & CSS frameworks like Foundation and Bootstrap, giving fresh candidates like Bulma a try, even fighting popular misconceptions like utility first , I finally wanted to build my own thing.  I am well-aware of the existence of a bazillion of CSS frameworks out there. And I know about the notion that CSS frameworks in general suck. So, who needs another one?  Well, I do. Why? Because its probably true: CSS frameworks suck. At least, they tend to be less helpful the more confident you are writing CSS from scratch. In other words: Having your website depend on a CSS framework can quickly become a pain in the ass. Bloated stylesheets, littered mark-up, opinionated solutions you dont agree with. How does that make sense? Building a CSS framework because CSS frameworks are bad? Its not that they are intrinsically bad. Its just that expecting such a framework to fit every use-case is futile. If you want an API (as in, a set of building blocks and means to customize them) that fits (almost) any kind of web document just rely on vanilla HTML and vanilla CSS. Its as easy as that. But its also easy to mess up. Of course, you need to establish reasonable structures for your HTML and CSS. Potentially reusable structures. Thats where your own personal HTML & CSS framework comes into play. Now it makes sense.  That being said, I cant tell if this project will ever be useful for anyone but me. Maybe people can learn from it, just as I have learned from others. How?  N. B.: The how is subject to change. A lot. Configure @use "stylament/css/axioms" with ( $config-custom: ( typography: ( font-weights: ( light: 300, regular: null, medium: null, semibold: null, bold: null, extrabold: 800, ), scale: ( min: -3, max: 9, factor: 1.5, ), line: ( root: 1.2, ), ), ) ); @use "stylament/css/elements"; @use "stylament/css/objects"; @use "stylament/css/utilities";

ob-elementary.html.title: Elementary
ob-elementary.html.contents: Main Navigation Bar Rather opinonated styling for the first nav.e-menu. body > nav.e-menu:first-of-type scss body > nav.e-menu:first-of-type { $size: var(--length-l2); --item-block-size: #{$size}; --item-line-height: var(--length-l1dim); --item-padding: var(--length-l1dim); --toggle-size: #{$size}; --toggle-padding: var(--length-l0to1); --toggle-shadow: var(--shadow-sm); --toggle-folded-shadow: var(--shadow-lg); & > menu { box-shadow: var(--shadow-sm); & > li { @include coloring.set-colors("nav", "alternate"); @include coloring.use-colors; transition: all 0.3s var(--ease-default); &:hover { @include coloring.use-colors-inverse; } & > a { color: inherit; background-color: transparent; font-weight: var(--weight-emphasis); text-decoration: none; } } } } The first nav.e-menu is implicitly considered the main menu. Navigation Menu Common patterns for navigation menus. Separated into several aspects. $nav-wide scss $nav-wide: map.get(container.$sizes, "sm"); Breakpoint for switching to wide layout. $size scss $size: 2em; Size factor of the menu. nav.e-menu scss nav.e-menu { --item-block-size: #{$size}; display: flex; flex-direction: row; align-items: flex-start; & > input[id^="-toggle-state"], & > label[for^="-toggle-state"] { display: none; } & > menu { flex-grow: 1; } } General navigation menu. This is the basic selector with the basic rules applied. nav.e-menu.\+levelable scss nav.e-menu.\+levelable { & > menu { display: flex; flex-wrap: wrap; & > li { display: block; text-align: center; // Horizontal nav as long as items have enough space. // https://heydonworks.com/article/the-flexbox-holy-albatross/ flex-basis: calc(($nav-wide - 100%) * 999); flex-grow: 1; } } } Levelable Nav. Places items on a horizontal level if enough space is available. nav.e-menu.\+foldable scss nav.e-menu.\+foldable { --toggle-size: #{$size}; /// Places toggle to the inline end (rhs in Latin). &.\+end { flex-direction: row-reverse; } & > label[for^="-toggle-state"] { cursor: context-menu; display: block; @include coloring.set-colors("nav-toggle", "alternate"); /// Toggle & > :first-child, &:empty::after { @include coloring.use-colors; display: block; position: relative; // Place over backdrop. inline-size: var(--toggle-size); block-size: var(--toggle-size); padding: var(--toggle-padding); border: var(--toggle-border); margin: 0; font-size: calc(var(--toggle-size) - 2 * var(--toggle-padding)); line-height: 1; text-align: center; font-weight: var(--weight-emphasis); transition: all 0.3s var(--ease-default); border-radius: var(--toggle-radius); box-shadow: var(--toggle-shadow); content: var(--toggle-content, ""); } } & > menu { margin-bottom: -100%; // Do not occupy flow space when foldable. max-inline-size: 100%; overflow: hidden; transition: max-inline-size 0.3s var(--ease-default); } // Special behavior on narrow screen: Act as overlay with backdrop. @media (max-width: $nav-wide) { & > input[id^="-toggle-state"] { // Unfolded state on narrow screen. &:checked { // Use `label` as backdrop. Clicking on it toggles the state. & ~ label[for^="-toggle-state"]::before { content: ""; position: absolute; inset: 0; block-size: 100vh; background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5); } } // Folded state on narrow screen. (This is the default, as in not checked.) &:not(:checked) { & ~ menu { @include menu-folded; } & ~ label[for^="-toggle-state"] > :first-child, & ~ label[for^="-toggle-state"]:empty::after { @include toggle-folded; } } } & > menu { position: relative; // Place over backdrop. } } // Folded state on wide screen. (Only when explicitly toggled.) @media (min-width: $nav-wide) { & > input[id^="-toggle-state"]:checked { & ~ menu { @include menu-folded; } & ~ label[for^="-toggle-state"] > :first-child, & ~ label[for^="-toggle-state"]:empty::after { @include toggle-folded; } } } } Foldable Nav. Allows to toggle the display of the menu. &.\+end scss &.\+end { flex-direction: row-reverse; } Places toggle to the inline end (rhs in Latin). & > :first-child, &:empty::after scss & > :first-child, &:empty::after { @include coloring.use-colors; display: block; position: relative; // Place over backdrop. inline-size: var(--toggle-size); block-size: var(--toggle-size); padding: var(--toggle-padding); border: var(--toggle-border); margin: 0; font-size: calc(var(--toggle-size) - 2 * var(--toggle-padding)); line-height: 1; text-align: center; font-weight: var(--weight-emphasis); transition: all 0.3s var(--ease-default); border-radius: var(--toggle-radius); box-shadow: var(--toggle-shadow); content: var(--toggle-content, ""); } Toggle nav.e-menu.\+sticky scss nav.e-menu.\+sticky { position: sticky; inset-block-start: 0; z-index: 1; } Sticky Nav. Makes navbar stick to the top of the viewport. table.e-standard-table scss table.e-standard-table { --table-border-width: var(--stroke-width-table, var(--stroke-width-default)); --table-border-style: var(--stroke-style-table, var(--stroke-style-default)); --table-border-color: var(--stroke-color-table, var(--stroke-color-default)); thead { background-color: var(--background-heavy, var(--color-mark-contra)); } tr:nth-child(2n) { background-color: var(--background-light, var(--color-alternate-contra)); } // Do not center `th` in vertical tables. thead + tbody { th:first-child { text-align: start; } } } Standard table style. In contrast to the neutral styles applied to the bare table element this adds some borders and stripes.

ob-special.html.title: More Specific Styling
ob-special.html.contents: Homepage Header, alternative body.s-homepage > header.\+alt scss body.s-homepage > header.\+alt { --radius-box: var(--radius-xl); --stroke-width-box: var(--stroke-width-8); --stroke-style-box: dashed; --stroke-color-box: var(--color-grey-200); --spacing-block: var(--length-l2); & > * { @extend .l-center-box; @extend %l-center--intrinsic; } } Special homepage header styles. Homepage Header body.s-homepage > header scss body.s-homepage > header { @extend .l-cover; h1 { font-size: clamp(var(--scale-3), 8vmin, var(--scale-9)); } & > * { @extend %l-center--intrinsic; } // Any image alone in an hgroup row is considered a logo. hgroup > * > img:only-child { // Size it so that it nicely fits the viewport. max-inline-size: 66vmin; max-block-size: 66vmin; // Dont measure-limit width of logo container. :has(&) { max-inline-size: none; } } } Special homepage header styles.

ut-layout.html.title: Layout Utilities
ut-layout.html.contents: .u-measure-#{$name} scss .u-measure-#{$name} { --measure: var(--measure-#{$name}) !important; } Specify individual measure. .u-wrap-reset scss .u-wrap-reset { grid-column: 1 / -1 !important; max-inline-size: unset !important; flex: 100% !important; } Reset wrapping.
